title: Bob Dylan - Folksinger's Choice - Interview and Songs - mp3
description:
In February of 1962, less than a month before the release of his debut album, an obscure young folk singer named Bob Dylan recorded some songs and an interview for a local New York City radio show called FolksingerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Choice.

The show was broadcast on WBAI and hosted by Cynthia Gooding, an established folk singer 17 years older than Dylan. As it happened, both Gooding and Dylan were native Minnesotans. Gooding had first met Dylan in Minneapolis in late 1959, not long after he graduated from high school.

As the interview gets rolling, the 20-year-old Dylan wastes little time before launching into some tall tales about his past. He says he moved to Minneapolis from South Dakota, because Minneapolis was Ã¢â‚¬Å“about the only place you didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have to go too far to find the Mississippi River.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Before that, he says, he traveled with a carnival, Ã¢â‚¬Å“off and on for about six years.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ When Gooding asks whether that might have interfered with his schooling, Dylan doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t miss a beat.
